verses.kjv: And Ahab had seventy sons in Samaria. And Jehu wrote letters, and sent to Samaria, unto the rulers of Jezreel, to the elders, and to them that brought up Ahab’s children, saying,
verses.web: Now Ahab had seventy sons in Samaria. Jehu wrote letters, and sent to Samaria, to the rulers of Jezreel, even the elders, and to those who brought up Ahab’s sons, saying,
verses.ct: Ahab had 70 sons living in Samaria. Jehu wrote letters and sent them to Samaria — to the rulers of Jezreel, the elders, and the guardians who were raising Ahab's children. The letters said:

verses.kjv: Now as soon as this letter cometh to you, seeing your master’s sons are with you, and there are with you chariots and horses, a fenced city also, and armour;
verses.web: “Now as soon as this letter comes to you, since your master’s sons are with you, and you have chariots and horses, a fortified city also, and armor,
verses.ct: "As soon as you receive this letter, consider your situation: your master's sons are with you, and you have chariots, horses, a fortified city, and weapons.

verses.kjv: Look even out the best and meetest of your master’s sons, and set him on his father’s throne, and fight for your master’s house.
verses.web: Select the best and fittest of your master’s sons, set him on his father’s throne, and fight for your master’s house.”
verses.ct: Choose the best and most capable of your master's sons, put him on his father's throne, and fight for your master's family."

verses.kjv: But they were exceedingly afraid, and said, Behold, two kings stood not before him: how then shall we stand?
verses.web: But they were exceedingly afraid, and said, “Behold, the two kings didn’t stand before him! How then shall we stand?”
verses.ct: But the leaders were terrified. They said to each other, "Two kings couldn't stand against him! How could we possibly resist?"

verses.kjv: And he that was over the house, and he that was over the city, the elders also, and the bringers up of the children, sent to Jehu, saying, We are thy servants, and will do all that thou shalt bid us; we will not make any king: do thou that which is good in thine eyes.
verses.web: He who was over the household, and he who was over the city, the elders also, and those who raised the children, sent to Jehu, saying, “We are your servants, and will do all that you ask us. We will not make any man king. You do that which is good in your eyes.”
verses.ct: So the palace manager, the city governor, the elders, and the guardians of the children sent a message back to Jehu: "We are your servants. We'll do whatever you tell us. We won't make anyone king — do whatever you think is best."

verses.kjv: Then he wrote a letter the second time to them, saying, If ye be mine, and if ye will hearken unto my voice, take ye the heads of the men your master’s sons, and come to me to Jezreel by to morrow this time. Now the king’s sons, being seventy persons, were with the great men of the city, which brought them up.
verses.web: Then he wrote a letter the second time to them, saying, “If you are on my side, and if you will listen to my voice, take the heads of the men who are your master’s sons, and come to me to Jezreel by tomorrow this time.” Now the king’s sons, being seventy persons, were with the great men of the city, who brought them up.
verses.ct: Jehu wrote them a second letter: "If you are truly on my side and will obey me, cut off the heads of your master's sons and bring them to me at Jezreel by this time tomorrow." Now the 70 royal sons were being raised by the leading men of the city.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when the letter came to them, that they took the king’s sons, and slew seventy persons, and put their heads in baskets, and sent him them to Jezreel.
verses.web: When the letter came to them, they took the king’s sons and killed them, even seventy people, and put their heads in baskets, and sent them to him to Jezreel.
verses.ct: When the letter arrived, the city leaders seized all 70 of the king's sons and killed them. They put their heads in baskets and sent them to Jehu at Jezreel.

verses.kjv: And there came a messenger, and told him, saying, They have brought the heads of the king’s sons. And he said, Lay ye them in two heaps at the entering in of the gate until the morning.
verses.web: A messenger came and told him, “They have brought the heads of the king’s sons.” He said, “Lay them in two heaps at the entrance of the gate until the morning.”
verses.ct: A messenger came and told Jehu, "They've delivered the heads of the king's sons." Jehu ordered, "Stack them in two piles at the city gate entrance and leave them there until morning."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass in the morning, that he went out, and stood, and said to all the people, Ye be righteous: behold, I conspired against my master, and slew him: but who slew all these?
verses.web: In the morning, he went out, and stood, and said to all the people, “You are righteous. Behold, I conspired against my master and killed him, but who killed all these?
verses.ct: The next morning, Jehu went out and stood before all the people. He said, "You are innocent in this. Yes, I conspired against my master and killed him — but who killed all of these?

verses.kjv: Know now that there shall fall unto the earth nothing of the word of the LORD, which the LORD spake concerning the house of Ahab: for the LORD hath done that which he spake by his servant Elijah.
verses.web: Know now that nothing will fall to the earth of LORD’s word, which LORD spoke concerning Ahab’s house. For LORD has done that which he spoke by his servant Elijah.”
verses.ct: Understand this: not a single word the LORD spoke against Ahab's family has failed. The LORD has carried out exactly what he promised through his servant Elijah."

verses.kjv: So Jehu slew all that remained of the house of Ahab in Jezreel, and all his great men, and his kinsfolks, and his priests, until he left him none remaining.
verses.web: So Jehu struck all that remained of Ahab’s house in Jezreel, with all his great men, his familiar friends, and his priests, until he left him no one remaining.
verses.ct: Then Jehu killed everyone who was left of Ahab's family in Jezreel — all his officials, his close associates, and his priests. He didn't spare a single one.

verses.kjv: And he arose and departed, and came to Samaria. And as he was at the shearing house in the way,
verses.web: He arose and departed, and went to Samaria. As he was at the shearing house of the shepherds on the way,
verses.ct: After that, Jehu set out for Samaria. Along the way, he stopped at a shepherds' shearing house.

verses.kjv: Jehu met with the brethren of Ahaziah king of Judah, and said, Who are ye? And they answered, We are the brethren of Ahaziah; and we go down to salute the children of the king and the children of the queen.
verses.web: Jehu met with the brothers of Ahaziah king of Judah, and said, “Who are you?” They answered, “We are the brothers of Ahaziah. We are going down to greet the children of the king and the children of the queen.”
verses.ct: There he ran into relatives of King Ahaziah of Judah. "Who are you?" he asked. They replied, "We're relatives of Ahaziah. We're on our way to visit the king's children and the queen's children."

verses.kjv: And he said, Take them alive. And they took them alive, and slew them at the pit of the shearing house, even two and forty men; neither left he any of them.
verses.web: He said, “Take them alive!” They took them alive, and killed them at the pit of the shearing house, even forty-two men. He didn’t leave any of them.
verses.ct: "Take them alive!" Jehu ordered. His men captured them and slaughtered all 42 of them at the pit near the shearing house. He didn't spare a single one.

verses.kjv: And when he was departed thence, he lighted on Jehonadab the son of Rechab coming to meet him: and he saluted him, and said to him, Is thine heart right, as my heart is with thy heart? And Jehonadab answered, It is. If it be, give me thine hand. And he gave him his hand; and he took him up to him into the chariot.
verses.web: When he had departed from there, he met Jehonadab the son of Rechab coming to meet him. He greeted him, and said to him, “Is your heart right, as my heart is with your heart?” Jehonadab answered, “It is.” “If it is, give me your hand.” He gave him his hand; and he took him up to him into the chariot.
verses.ct: After leaving there, Jehu encountered Jehonadab son of Rechab, who was coming to meet him. Jehu greeted him and asked, "Are you as committed to me as I am to you?" Jehonadab answered, "I am." "Then give me your hand," Jehu said. Jehonadab reached out his hand, and Jehu pulled him up into the chariot.

verses.kjv: And he said, Come with me, and see my zeal for the LORD. So they made him ride in his chariot.
verses.web: He said, “Come with me, and see my zeal for LORD.” So they made him ride in his chariot.
verses.ct: "Come with me," Jehu said, "and watch how passionate I am for the LORD." So Jehonadab rode along in his chariot.

verses.kjv: And when he came to Samaria, he slew all that remained unto Ahab in Samaria, till he had destroyed him, according to the saying of the LORD, which he spake to Elijah.
verses.web: When he came to Samaria, he struck all who remained to Ahab in Samaria, until he had destroyed him, according to LORD’s word, which he spoke to Elijah.
verses.ct: When Jehu arrived in Samaria, he killed everyone left from Ahab's family there, wiping them out completely — just as the LORD had told Elijah would happen.

verses.kjv: And Jehu gathered all the people together, and said unto them, Ahab served Baal a little; but Jehu shall serve him much.
verses.web: Jehu gathered all the people together, and said to them, “Ahab served Baal a little; but Jehu will serve him much.
verses.ct: Then Jehu assembled all the people and announced, "Ahab served Baal only a little. Jehu will serve him far more.

verses.kjv: Now therefore call unto me all the prophets of Baal, all his servants, and all his priests; let none be wanting: for I have a great sacrifice to do to Baal; whosoever shall be wanting, he shall not live. But Jehu did it in subtilty, to the intent that he might destroy the worshippers of Baal.
verses.web: Now therefore call to me all the prophets of Baal, all of his worshipers, and all of his priests. Let no one be absent; for I have a great sacrifice to Baal. Whoever is absent, he shall not live.” But Jehu did deceptively, intending to destroy the worshipers of Baal.
verses.ct: Now summon every prophet of Baal, every worshiper, and every priest. No one is to be absent, because I'm planning a great sacrifice to Baal. Anyone who doesn't show up will be put to death." But this was all a trick — Jehu's real plan was to destroy every worshiper of Baal.

verses.kjv: And Jehu said, Proclaim a solemn assembly for Baal. And they proclaimed it.
verses.web: Jehu said, “Sanctify a solemn assembly for Baal!” So they proclaimed it.
verses.ct: Jehu commanded, "Announce a sacred assembly for Baal!" So they sent out the proclamation.

verses.kjv: And Jehu sent through all Israel: and all the worshippers of Baal came, so that there was not a man left that came not. And they came into the house of Baal; and the house of Baal was full from one end to another.
verses.web: Jehu sent through all Israel; and all the worshipers of Baal came, so that there was not a man left that didn’t come. They came into the house of Baal; and the house of Baal was filled from one end to another.
verses.ct: Jehu sent word throughout all of Israel, and every worshiper of Baal came — not a single one stayed home. They packed into the temple of Baal until it was full from wall to wall.

verses.kjv: And he said unto him that was over the vestry, Bring forth vestments for all the worshippers of Baal. And he brought them forth vestments.
verses.web: He said to him who kept the wardrobe, “Bring out robes for all the worshipers of Baal!” So he brought robes out to them.
verses.ct: Jehu told the keeper of the wardrobe, "Bring out robes for all the worshipers of Baal." So he brought out robes for everyone.

verses.kjv: And Jehu went, and Jehonadab the son of Rechab, into the house of Baal, and said unto the worshippers of Baal, Search, and look that there be here with you none of the servants of the LORD, but the worshippers of Baal only.
verses.web: Jehu went with Jehonadab the son of Rechab into the house of Baal. Then he said to the worshipers of Baal, “Search, and see that none of the servants of LORD are here with you, but only the worshipers of Baal.”
verses.ct: Then Jehu and Jehonadab son of Rechab entered the temple of Baal. Jehu told the worshipers, "Look around carefully and make sure no servants of the LORD are in here — only worshipers of Baal."

verses.kjv: And when they went in to offer sacrifices and burnt offerings, Jehu appointed fourscore men without, and said, If any of the men whom I have brought into your hands escape, he that letteth him go, his life shall be for the life of him.
verses.web: So they went in to offer sacrifices and burnt offerings. Now Jehu had appointed for himself eighty men outside, and said, “If any of the men whom I bring into your hands escape, he who lets him go, his life shall be for the life of him.”
verses.ct: As the worshipers went inside to offer sacrifices and burnt offerings, Jehu had stationed 80 soldiers outside. He warned them, "If any of the men I'm handing over to you escapes, the soldier who let him go will pay with his own life."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, as soon as he had made an end of offering the burnt offering, that Jehu said to the guard and to the captains, Go in, and slay them; let none come forth. And they smote them with the edge of the sword; and the guard and the captains cast them out, and went to the city of the house of Baal.
verses.web: As soon as he had finished offering the burnt offering, Jehu said to the guard and to the captains, “Go in and kill them! Let no one escape.” So they struck them with the edge of the sword. The guard and the captains threw the bodies out, and went to the inner shrine of the house of Baal.
verses.ct: The moment the burnt offering was finished, Jehu ordered the guards and captains, "Go in and kill them all! Don't let anyone escape!" They cut them down with swords. The guards and captains threw the bodies out, then pushed deeper into the inner shrine of Baal's temple.

verses.kjv: And they brought forth the images out of the house of Baal, and burned them.
verses.web: They brought out the pillars that were in the house of Baal, and burned them.
verses.ct: They dragged out the sacred pillars from the temple of Baal and burned them.

verses.kjv: And they brake down the image of Baal, and brake down the house of Baal, and made it a draught house unto this day.
verses.web: They broke down the pillar of Baal, and broke down the house of Baal, and made it a latrine, to this day.
verses.ct: They smashed the pillar of Baal, tore down the entire temple, and turned the site into a latrine — which it remains to this day.

verses.kjv: Thus Jehu destroyed Baal out of Israel.
verses.web: Thus Jehu destroyed Baal out of Israel.
verses.ct: That is how Jehu wiped out Baal worship from Israel.

verses.kjv: Howbeit from the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, who made Israel to sin, Jehu departed not from after them, to wit, the golden calves that were in Bethel, and that were in Dan.
verses.web: However, Jehu didn’t depart from the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, with which he made Israel to sin, the golden calves that were in Bethel and that were in Dan.
verses.ct: However, Jehu did not turn away from the sins that Jeroboam son of Nebat had led Israel into — specifically, the golden calves set up at Bethel and Dan.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Jehu, Because thou hast done well in executing that which is right in mine eyes, and hast done unto the house of Ahab according to all that was in mine heart, thy children of the fourth generation shall sit on the throne of Israel.
verses.web: LORD said to Jehu, “Because you have done well in executing that which is right in my eyes, and have done to Ahab’s house according to all that was in my heart, your descendants shall sit on the throne of Israel to the fourth generation.”
verses.ct: The LORD said to Jehu, "Because you carried out what I wanted and dealt with Ahab's family exactly as I had in mind, your descendants will sit on the throne of Israel for 4 generations."

verses.kjv: But Jehu took no heed to walk in the law of the LORD God of Israel with all his heart: for he departed not from the sins of Jeroboam, which made Israel to sin.
verses.web: But Jehu took no heed to walk in the law of LORD, the God of Israel, with all his heart. He didn’t depart from the sins of Jeroboam, with which he made Israel to sin.
verses.ct: But Jehu didn't make any effort to follow the law of the LORD, the God of Israel, with all his heart. He never turned away from the sins of Jeroboam that had led Israel into sin.

verses.kjv: In those days the LORD began to cut Israel short: and Hazael smote them in all the coasts of Israel;
verses.web: In those days LORD began to cut away parts of Israel; and Hazael struck them in all the borders of Israel;
verses.ct: During those days, the LORD began to shrink Israel's territory. Hazael attacked them along every border —

verses.kjv: From Jordan eastward, all the land of Gilead, the Gadites, and the Reubenites, and the Manassites, from Aroer, which is by the river Arnon, even Gilead and Bashan.
verses.web: from the Jordan eastward, all the land of Gilead, the Gadites, and the Reubenites, and the Manassites, from Aroer, which is by the valley of the Arnon, even Gilead and Bashan.
verses.ct: everything east of the Jordan: all of Gilead, including the lands of the tribes of Gad, Reuben, and Manasseh, from Aroer by the Arnon Valley all the way through Gilead and Bashan.

verses.kjv: Now the rest of the acts of Jehu, and all that he did, and all his might, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?
verses.web: Now the rest of the acts of Jehu, and all that he did, and all his might, aren’t they written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?
verses.ct: Everything else about Jehu's reign — all he accomplished and all his power — is recorded in the official history of Israel's kings.

verses.kjv: And Jehu slept with his fathers: and they buried him in Samaria. And Jehoahaz his son reigned in his stead.
verses.web: Jehu slept with his fathers; and they buried him in Samaria. Jehoahaz his son reigned in his place.
verses.ct: Jehu died and was buried in Samaria. His son Jehoahaz became king after him.

verses.kjv: And the time that Jehu reigned over Israel in Samaria was twenty and eight years.
verses.web: The time that Jehu reigned over Israel in Samaria was twenty-eight years.
verses.ct: Jehu reigned over Israel in Samaria for 28 years.
